name: Garlic Chicken Stir-Fry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add garlic and chicken and stir-fry until cooked. Add bell pepper and broccoli, stir for 2-3 minutes. Mix cornstarch with water and soy sauce, pour over chicken and veggies. Add oyster sauce, stir until sauce thickens. Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Quick Chicken Biryani
instructions: Wash and soak rice for 15 minutes. In a pan, heat oil, fry onions until golden. Add ginger garlic paste, chicken, and cook until half done. Add tomatoes, yogurt, biryani masala, salt, and cook until chicken is tender. Layer rice on top, cover tightly and cook on low heat for 15 minutes. Serve with raita.

name: Chana Masala
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add onions, garlic, and ginger and sauté until golden. Add tomatoes and cook until soft. Add coriander powder, garam masala, salt, and chickpeas. Add water to desired consistency, simmer for 10 minutes. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with rice or naan.

name: Quick Bean Tacos
instructions: Heat beans with chili powder and cumin until warm. Warm tortillas in a pan. Fill each tortilla with beans, lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, and salsa. Serve immediately.

name: Pasta Primavera
instructions: Cook pasta according to package. In a pan, heat olive oil, add garlic and vegetables and sauté until tender. Toss cooked pasta with veggies, season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle Parmesan and basil on top. Serve warm.

name: Greek Salad
instructions: Combine cucumber, tomatoes, onion, olives, and feta in a bowl. Whisk olive oil, vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper. Pour dressing over salad and toss gently. Serve chilled.

name: Egg Fried Rice
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, scramble eggs and set aside. In the same pan, sauté peas and carrots, add rice and soy sauce. Stir well, add scrambled eggs and green onions. Mix and cook for 2 more minutes. Serve hot.

name: Aloo Gobi (Potato Cauliflower Curry)
instructions: Heat oil, add cumin seeds until they splutter. Add onions and sauté until golden. Add tomatoes and spices, cook until oil separates. Add potatoes and cauliflower, mix well, cover and cook until tender. Garnish with coriander and serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Masoor Dal (Red Lentil Curry)
instructions: Rinse lentils and cook with turmeric and water until soft. In another pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds, onions, and garlic, sauté until golden. Add tomatoes and garam masala, cook until soft. Mix cooked lentils into the pan, simmer 5 minutes. Garnish and serve with rice or naan.

name: Simple Guacamole
instructions: Mash avocados in a bowl. Add onion, tomato, lime juice, cilantro, salt, and pepper. Mix gently and serve immediately with tortilla chips or as a topping.

name: Tomato Basil Bruschetta
instructions: Toast baguette slices until golden. Mix tomatoes, basil, garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Spoon mixture on toasted bread and serve immediately.

name: Classic Hummus
instructions: Blend chickpeas, tahini, olive oil, garlic, lemon juice, and salt until smooth. Add water gradually to reach desired consistency. Serve with pita bread or veggies.

name: Hot and Sour Soup
ingredients: 1 tbsp cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp water
instructions: Bring broth to boil, add mushrooms and tofu. Mix soy sauce, vinegar, and chili paste, add to pot. Slowly pour in cornstarch slurry to thicken. Drizzle in beaten egg while stirring. Garnish with green onions and serve hot.

name: Saag (Spinach Curry)
instructions: Heat oil, add cumin seeds, onions, garlic, and ginger, sauté until golden. Add tomatoes and cook until soft. Add spinach and salt, cover and cook until wilted. Blend slightly for creamy texture, stir in garam masala and cook 5 more minutes. Serve with naan or rice.

name: Jeera Rice (Cumin Rice)
instructions: Rinse rice until water runs clear. Heat ghee/oil, add cumin seeds, bay leaf, and cloves until fragrant. Add rice and salt, sauté briefly. Add water, bring to boil, cover and simmer on low for 15 minutes. Fluff with fork and serve.

name: Chinese Red-Cooked Beef (Hong Shao Niu Rou Style)
ingredients: 1.5 lbs beef brisket or chuck, cut into cubes
instructions: Blanch beef cubes in boiling water for 5 minutes, then drain. Heat oil in pot, add ginger and garlic until fragrant. Add beef, sugar, and stir until sugar caramelizes slightly. Add soy sauces, Shaoxing wine, star anise, cinnamon, green onions, and water. Bring to boil, then simmer covered for 2-3 hours or until beef is tender. Serve with steamed rice.

name: Nihari (Slow-Cooked Beef Stew)
ingredients: 2 lbs beef shank or stew meat
Fresh ginger julienne and lemon for garnish
instructions: Heat oil, sauté onions until golden. Add ginger garlic paste, sauté. Add beef, turmeric, chili powder, salt, and nihari masala. Mix well and cook for 10 minutes. Add water, cover and cook on low heat for 6-8 hours (overnight preferred) until beef is very tender and broth is rich. Garnish with ginger, cilantro, green chilies, and lemon wedges. Serve hot with naan.

name: Butter Chicken (Murgh Makhani)
ingredients: 1 lb chicken thighs, boneless and skinless
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, lemon juice, turmeric, chili powder, and garam masala for at least 4 hours or overnight. Grill or pan-fry chicken until cooked. In a pan, melt butter, sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until golden. Add tomato puree, cook until oil separates. Add cream and salt. Add chicken pieces and simmer for 15 minutes. Garnish with cilantro. Serve with naan or rice.

name: Mexican Carnitas (Slow-Cooked Pork, Pork-Free Version)
ingredients: 2 lbs boneless chicken thighs or beef chuck roast
instructions: Combine chicken or beef with orange juice, lime juice, garlic, onion, cumin, oregano, salt, pepper, and bay leaves in a slow cooker. Cook on low for 6-8 hours until meat is tender and shreds easily. Remove meat and crisp under broiler or in hot pan if desired. Serve with tortillas, salsa, and lime wedges.

name: Osso Buco (Braised Veal Shanks)
ingredients: 1 cup white wine (can substitute with chicken broth)
instructions: Season shanks with salt and pepper, dredge in flour. Brown shanks in olive oil, set aside. Sauté onion, carrot, celery, and garlic until soft. Deglaze pan with wine or broth. Add broth, tomatoes, tomato paste, thyme, bay leaf, and shanks. Cover and braise in oven at 325°F for 2.5 to 3 hours until meat is tender. Garnish with parsley. Serve with risotto or polenta.

name: Moroccan Lamb Tagine
ingredients: 2 lbs lamb shoulder, cut into chunks
instructions: Heat olive oil in a heavy pot, brown lamb pieces on all sides. Remove lamb. Sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until soft. Add spices, cook for 1 minute. Return lamb, add broth and apricots. Cover and simmer on low for 2-3 hours until lamb is tender. Garnish with cilantro and almonds. Serve with couscous.

name: Chinese Soy-Braised Beef Brisket
instructions: Blanch beef brisket, then drain. Heat oil in pot, add ginger, garlic, star anise, and cinnamon until fragrant. Add beef and sugar, caramelize slightly. Add soy sauces, water, and green onions. Simmer for 2-3 hours until tender. Slice and serve with steamed rice.

name: Beef Korma
instructions: Heat oil and fry onions until golden brown. Add ginger garlic paste, sauté. Add beef cubes, turmeric, chili powder, and salt; cook until browned. Add yogurt and ground almonds, mix well. Cover and cook on low heat for 2-3 hours until beef is tender. Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with coriander. Serve with rice or naan.

name: Chicken Dum Biryani (Layered Biryani)
ingredients: 1/2 cup chopped mint and coriander leaves
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger garlic paste, turmeric, garam masala, salt, and half of the herbs for at least 2 hours. Parboil rice with salt and whole spices. In a heavy-bottomed pot, layer chicken and rice alternately, sprinkling herbs and saffron milk between layers. Seal pot and cook on low heat (dum) for 45-60 minutes. Serve with raita.

name: Mole Poblano (Traditional Mexican Sauce)
instructions: Toast chiles, seeds, almonds, tortilla, and spices separately until fragrant. Soak chiles in hot water for 20 minutes. Blend all ingredients with onion, garlic, tomato, and broth until smooth. Heat oil in a pot, cook the sauce for 20 minutes stirring constantly. Add chocolate and salt. Simmer sauce with cooked chicken for 1 hour before serving with rice.

name: Ragu Bolognese
instructions: Heat oil, sauté onion, carrots, celery, and garlic until soft. Add ground beef and brown. Add tomato puree, milk, and wine (if using). Simmer uncovered for at least 2 hours, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with pasta and Parmesan.

name: Mediterranean Stuffed Eggplant
instructions: Halve eggplants and scoop out flesh. Roast eggplant halves until soft. Sauté onion, garlic, tomatoes, and spices until cooked. Add chickpeas and pine nuts. Stuff mixture into eggplant shells. Bake for another 30 minutes at 375°F. Garnish with parsley and serve.

name: Sweet and Sour Chicken (Long Prep)
ingredients: 1 lb chicken breast, cut into bite-size pieces
instructions: Marinate chicken in egg, then coat with cornstarch. Deep fry until golden. In a pan, heat oil, add bell pepper and pineapple, sauté briefly. Mix vinegar, ketchup, sugar, and soy sauce, add to pan. Add fried chicken, toss to coat in sauce. Cook for 5 minutes. Serve with rice.

name: Haleem (Slow-Cooked Lentil and Meat Stew)
ingredients: Fresh coriander and fried onions for garnish
instructions: Soak wheat and lentils overnight. Cook meat with onions and spices until tender. Blend soaked wheat and lentils, add to meat. Cook on low heat for 4-6 hours stirring occasionally until creamy. Garnish with fried onions and coriander. Serve hot with naan.

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for at least 4 hours or overnight. Grill or pan-fry chicken until cooked. In a pan, sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until soft. Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates. Add cream and cooked chicken, simmer for 15 minutes. Garnish and serve with rice or naan.

name: Classic Mojito Mocktail
instructions: Muddle mint leaves and 1 lime wedge in a glass. Add 2 more lime wedges and sugar, muddle again. Fill glass with ice, top with club soda. Stir gently and garnish with remaining lime wedge and mint sprig.

name: Iced Matcha Latte
instructions: Whisk matcha powder with hot water until smooth and frothy. Fill glass with ice, pour milk, then add matcha mixture. Stir gently. Add honey if desired.

name: Cold Brew Coffee
instructions: Combine coffee grounds and cold water in a jar or pitcher. Stir gently, cover, and refrigerate for 12-24 hours. Strain through a fine mesh or coffee filter. Serve over ice with milk or sweetener as desired.

name: Pineapple Mango Smoothie
instructions: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Serve immediately.

name: Golden Milk (Turmeric Latte)
instructions: Heat milk gently, whisk in turmeric, cinnamon, and ginger. Sweeten with honey or maple syrup. Serve warm.

name: Fresh Ginger Lemonade
ingredients: 2 inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and sliced
instructions: Make a ginger syrup by simmering ginger with 1 cup water and honey for 10 minutes. Strain syrup. Mix ginger syrup with lemon juice and remaining water. Serve over ice.

name: Mint Lemonade
instructions: Muddle mint leaves with sugar. Add lemon juice and water, stir until sugar dissolves. Serve over ice with mint garnish.

name: Chai Tea Latte
instructions: Simmer water with cardamom, cinnamon, cloves, and ginger for 10 minutes. Add tea bags and steep 5 minutes. Remove tea and spices, add milk and sweetener. Heat until hot but not boiling. Serve warm.

name: Virgin Piña Colada
instructions: Blend pineapple juice, coconut milk, and crushed ice until smooth. Pour into glass and garnish with pineapple slice and cherry.

name: Strawberry Basil Lemonade
instructions: Muddle strawberries and basil in pitcher. Add lemon juice and sugar, stir until sugar dissolves. Add water and stir well. Chill and serve over ice.

name: Turmeric Cucumber Smoothie
instructions: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Serve immediately.

name: Carrot Orange Juice
instructions: Juice carrots, oranges, and ginger in a juicer. Serve over ice.

name: Cucumber Mint Infused Water
instructions: Add cucumber slices and mint leaves to a pitcher of water. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Serve chilled with ice.

name: Banana Berry Smoothie
instructions: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Serve immediately.

name: Hot Cocoa with Cinnamon
instructions: Heat milk in saucepan. Whisk in cocoa powder, sugar, and cinnamon until smooth and warm. Serve topped with whipped cream if desired.

name: Basbousa (Middle Eastern Semolina Cake)
ingredients: For syrup: 3/4 cup sugar, 1/2 cup water, 1 tsp lemon juice, 1 tsp rose water
instructions: Mix semolina, sugar, yogurt, coconut, butter, and baking powder. Pour into greased baking dish, flatten, and top with almonds. Bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes. Meanwhile, simmer syrup ingredients and pour over hot cake once baked. Cool before serving.

name: Rasmalai
ingredients: Cardamom powder, saffron, and chopped pistachios
instructions: Curdle milk to make chenna, knead and shape into balls. Boil in sugar syrup. Meanwhile, prepare rabri with milk, condensed milk, cardamom, and saffron. Soak balls in chilled rabri and garnish with nuts.

name: Mango Sticky Rice
instructions: Soak and steam glutinous rice. Heat coconut milk with sugar and salt. Mix most of it into warm rice and let sit. Serve with sliced mango and drizzle with extra coconut sauce.

name: Um Ali (Egyptian Bread Pudding)
instructions: Bake and shred puff pastry. Mix with nuts, coconut, and raisins in baking dish. Pour hot milk-cream-sugar mixture over it. Bake at 375°F until golden and bubbling.

name: Japanese Mochi (Microwave Method)
instructions: Mix flour, sugar, and water in microwave-safe bowl. Microwave in 1-minute intervals, stirring in between, until sticky and translucent. Dust surface with starch, roll and cut.

name: Banoffee Pie
instructions: Press biscuit-butter mix into pie dish. Chill. Spread dulce de leche, top with bananas, then whipped cream. Garnish with chocolate. Chill before serving.

name: Chocolate Avocado Mousse
instructions: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Chill before serving. Garnish with berries or nuts.

name: Pandan Layer Cake
instructions: Whip eggs and sugar. Add oil, milk, and pandan. Fold in flour and baking powder. Bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.

name: Zarda (Sweet Rice)
ingredients: 1/4 cup chopped nuts and dried fruit
Pinch of saffron or yellow food coloring
instructions: Boil rice with saffron or coloring. In a pan, heat ghee and add cardamom. Add rice, sugar, and nuts. Cook on low heat till sugar melts and rice is glazed.

name: Kheer (Rice Pudding)
instructions: Boil rice in milk, simmer for 30-40 minutes till thick. Add sugar, cardamom, and nuts. Chill before serving.

name: Red Bean Mooncakes
instructions: Make dough from syrup, oil, and flour. Chill. Shape dough around bean paste balls. Bake at 375°F for 10-12 minutes. Let rest 1–2 days before serving.

name: Semolina Halva (Sooji Halwa)
instructions: Roast semolina in ghee. Separately heat sugar and water. Add to semolina, stirring constantly. Cook till thick. Add cardamom and garnish.

name: Hoeddeok (Korean Sweet Pancakes)
ingredients: Filling: brown sugar, cinnamon, chopped walnuts
instructions: Make dough and rest 1 hour. Shape into balls, fill with sugar/nut mix. Pan-fry until golden and caramelized inside.

name: Moroccan Orange & Cinnamon Salad
instructions: Arrange orange slices, sprinkle with cinnamon, sugar, and orange blossom water. Chill before serving.
